pr_title: Refactor MinioProperties class and fix os name in user-agent

timeline.message: Try to find the correct manifest and load the version info

timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Why do we need this? or what exactly the problem in current approach?
timeline.author: balamurugana

replies.bodyText:
When minio is included with other libraries - via maven/gradle - this manifest resources will list all the manifests from the classpath - We specifically need the manifest from the minio jar - so we can get the version number correctly.
An example is added here https://github.com/vinu/minio-check (using minio with spring boot)
I added 7.1.4 of minio library, so I was expecting the User-agent to have this version, but it was like this User-Agent: MinIO (x86_64; x86_64) minio-java/1.7.30
This is because the current implementation lists all manifests from the classpath, and just takes the Implementation-Version so the version info is overridden by some other manifest.
replies.author: vinu
balamurugana

replies.bodyText: Please check the latest push, hope that cleans things :)
replies.author: vinu

timeline.bodyText: Use these values directly than having constants.
timeline.author: balamurugana
balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: Set dev as default value i.e. move above this line and remove setting it later.
timeline.author: balamurugana

timeline.bodyText: This is not going to work. You are resetting the value on every iteration.
timeline.author: balamurugana

replies.author: balamurugana

replies.bodyText: Got rid of the for, we can directly pull in the values from the attributes and check
